Package de.oth.blocklib

Class WorldInteraction

java.lang.Object
de.oth.blocklib.WorldInteraction
All Implemented Interfaces:
PopulatingWorldInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClientWorldInteraction, ServerWorldInteraction, SinglePlayerWorldInteraction
public abstract class WorldInteraction
extends java.lang.Object
implements PopulatingWorldInterface
Used to interact with the World For Example: setting, removing stones
Author:
Tobias Mueller, Sven Kalle

    • getBlockInfoInFrontOfCamera

      public java.util.Optional<BlockInfo> getBlockInfoInFrontOfCamera​(Camera cam, float maxDistance)
      Calculates the position of the block that is pointed at by the ray out of the camera.

      The algorithm iteratively looks for the next integer intersection of the ray and checks if the block there is not an empty block.

      Parameters:
      cam - The camera instance from which the block is viewed
      maxDistance - The maximum distance the ray travels
      Returns:
      The BlockPos in front of the camera or null if maxDistance is exeeded.

    • getArea

      public short[][][] getArea​(Vector3i start, Vector3i areaSize)
      TODO: this can be solved with less performance returns an array of blocktypes, identical to the area in the world
      Parameters:
      start - the zero point of the requested area
      areaSize - the size of the rectangle that is wanted in each direction
      Returns:
      a blockType array which holds the types of blocks in the requested area

    • getAreaWithIdAndPositions

      Return a HashMap with the Item id as key and a List of positions

    • setArea

      public void setArea​(Vector3i start, short[][][] area, boolean setNothing)
      TODO: this can be solved with less performance sets the blocktypes of an whole area to the short defined in area
      Parameters:
      start - the zero point of the area
      area - array which contains the new short values.
      setNothing - if setNothing is false, every block is not changed if its corresponding block in area is nothing

    • setNegativeArea

      public void setNegativeArea​(Vector3i start, short[][][] area)
      deletes every block in the area, that is not nothing
      Parameters:
      start - the zero point of the area
      area - array which contains the new short values.
